abstracts.cdata!:
The restructuring of the Panama Land
            Administration Project, (see report no. 21444), which
            improves policies and regulations for sales and rental
            markets, protected areas, and indigenous peoples'
            lands, narrows the project's scope and simplifies two
            project development objectives. Reflecting the reduced scope
            of the operation, the project's total cost will fall by
            about 20 percent with a corresponding reduction in
            counterpart funding. The total loan amount remains
            unchanged. Other significant modifications include: 1)
            revising targets to better reflect the project development
            objectives; 2) creating a new component to separate quality
            control and monitoring activities; and 3) applying new
            financing parameters for Panama. With regard to
            implementation arrangements, the Ministry of Housing will be
            included as co-executing agency, given its active role in
            key project activities. Finally, the restructuring aims to:
            1) in crease the Special Account to 10 percent of the total
            loan amount; (2) reallocate expenditure categories; and (3)
            use a financial administrator for the project.
